result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda M Shanklin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 9/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 12 days jail, consecutive, for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine.  
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda M Shanklin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amanda M Shanklin in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
FINE: $379.00 (to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 9/1/16 or serve 12 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment).
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 to be paid at $50.00 per month consecutive to payment on fine. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Sentencing hearing on July 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Amanda M Shanklin in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read into Count #2. 
Attorney Kershek requests the Court set the matter for sentencing in 30 to 45 days.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
From State dated 4/20/16 requesting adjournment of trial.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 7, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on June 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Amanda M Shanklin in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek requests the Court set the matter for trial in June.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 08:15 am.
From Alliance Counseling Center dated 1/6/16 re defendant's progress in program.

Defendant Amanda M Shanklin in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek advises the Court the Defendant is currently enrolled in treatment.  He has received discovery and an offer.  Attorney Kershek to advise the Court how the case will proceed at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in criminal complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Amanda M Shanklin in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
From Alliance Counseling Center dated 12/7/15 re defendant's participation in program.
